results.title: Spider-man: the new animated series
results.creator_credit: Various, Mainframe Entertainment and Adelaide Productions
results.brief_description: Modernised, highly amusing and very cool animated series about Spider-man, aka Peter Parker, focusing on his college years, as he tries to study, make sense of his love life, earn a living and keep the streets crime-free as a super-hero. This is the entire first series and the episodes include: Heroes and villians; Royal scam; Law of the jungle; Sword of Shikata; Keeping secrets; Tight squeeze; Head over heels; The Party; Flash memory; Spider-man disabled; When sparks fly; Mind Games Part 1 & 2. This is the first completely computer generated “Spider-man” and features the voices of Neil Patrick Harris, Lisa Loeb, and Ian Ziering. Based on the Marvel comic book character created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko.

results.title: Spider-man: The Hobgoblin. The Menace of Mysterio
results.brief_description: Spider-Man and his alter ego Peter Parker feature in these two animated adventures by John Semper. “The Hobgoblin”: Peter moves into a new apartment with rich friend Harry Osborn who has a powerful but absent father. Peter and Harry attend the opening of the Fisk School of Criminology and trouble ensues when an attempt is made on Fisk’s life by the Hobgoblin. Fisk is also a Kingpin; Harry’s father the silent partner. When Harry is kidnapped, Mr Osborn is forced to choose between his son and his invention. Voices provided by: Christopher Daniel Barnes, Edward Asner, Linda Gary, Maxwell Caulfield, Mark Hamill. “The Menace of Mysterio”: Jewels are stolen from the Metropolitan Museum and the thief is sighted as none other than Spider-Man. Mysterio, a media hungry creature in a costume, sans head, puts Spider-Man on notice and vows to replace him as super hero for the city. Is Mysterio a clever magician or a worthy super villain opponent? Voices provided by: Christopher Daniel Barnes, Edward Asner, Linda Gary, Gregg Berger.

results.title: Spider-man [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Ian Bryce, Laura Ziskin, Marvel Entertainment and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Sam Raimi (famed for his iconic horror work in Darkman and Evil Dead) delivers - “Spider-man”, adapted from the Marvel Comics book character, is a canny mix of entertaining CG imagery, exhilarating action sequences, and a humanistic portrayal of the man behind the mask. Initially Spider-man aka Peter Parker is an awkward teenager with a smattering of friends and a serious crush on his spunky neighbour Mary Jane. After being bitten by a spider, Parker, much to his dismay, develops super-human reflexes, the ability to project powerful webs, and the knack for climbing walls. Upon experiencing some harsh life lessons, Parker becomes aware of the responsibility attendant with his awesome capabilities. The story also follows the romancing of Mary Jane as she finds her feet in Manhattan and dates Parker’s best friend and roommate Harry Osborne. Raimi achieves impact with this film on an emotional level that has been sorely lacking from so many comic book adaptations. He does this by imparting Parker with problems that an audience can relate to - thwarted love, disappointment, guilt and grief - woes that Spider-man’s phenomenal strengths cannot combat. Maguire imbues the title role with sensitivity and gravitas, whilst character actor Willem Dafoe ably plays a dual role of Norman Osborn, and Parker’s arch-nemesis, the Green Goblin.

results.title: Spider
results.creator_credit: Kyle Neaves, Neill S. Bell and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Charts a man’s gradual progress into obsession with catching the spiders that he discovers have infested his basement. Shot using the latest miniature camera technology, the story is told through the eyes of a spider.

results.title: Spider
results.creator_credit: Graham Yost, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
Before America could land on the moon, it had to devise the lunar module named “LEM” or “Spider”. From an idea on a sketch pad to design and construction; through nine years of rigorous tests, successes and failures. 1969 will witness the first ever docking of two manned vessels in space on Apollo 9, and the first flight of a lunar module in the moon’s orbit on Apollo 10. With all systems go, that same year would see the lift-off of Apollo 11.

results.title: Spiceworld: The Movie
results.brief_description: Zany adventure that follows The Spice Girls and their entourage (mostly fictional characters) - manager Clifford, his assistant Deborah, and filmmaker Piers (who is trying to shoot a documentary on “the real Spice Girls”).

constellations_other.name: Alice Babidge and True History of the Kelly Gang
constellations_other.description: An acclaimed set, costume, and production designer in the world of theatre, Alice Babidge has most recently been working in film including Justin Kurzel features Snowtown and True History Of The Kelly Gang.

results.description: Zany adventure that follows The Spice Girls and their entourage (mostly fictional characters) - manager Clifford, his assistant Deborah, and filmmaker Piers (who is trying to shoot a documentary on “the real Spice Girls”).

results.title: Spiceworld: the movie
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Barnaby Thompson, Uri Fruchtmann and Fragile Films
results.brief_description: A thriller with a little romance and a lot of comedy, “Spiceworld” chronicles the five crazy days leading to the Spice Girls’ first live concert at the Royal Albert Hall. Photojournalists follow as they travel from press conferences to practice sessions to photo shoots, passing London landmarks in the comfort of their tardis Spicebus and emerging into a musical cascade of colour, trendy clothes and blinding flashbulbs. Exploring the trials and tribulations of their global fame, “Spiceworld” takes a satirical stab at the media giants and commercial junkies who relentlessly compete to manufacture the girls’ success or demise. Cast includes The Spice Girls, Richard E. Grant, Alan Cumming, George Wendt, Claire Rushbrook and Roger Moore.

results.title: Spherical mirrors
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Light”.
Explains the basic properties of convex and concave mirrors, contrasting real and virtual image formation, and illustrates practical applications.

results.title: Spheres
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A play on motion, against a background of multi-hued sky. Spheres of translucent pearl seem to float weightlessly in the unlimited panorama of the sky, grouping, regrouping, at times colliding like some stylised burst of the atomic chain reaction. Set to the music of Bach, played by pianist Glenn Gould. (Awards: Cordoba)

results.title: Sperm cell development in the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This film is chiefly interesting as an example of the use of film in the service of science, in this case, microcinematography. Living cells are shown developing by the use of phase contrast microscopy, a method due to Zernicke, which gives increased contrast by optical means, and without staining.
